page.title: 19HOSPITAL 4
page.content:
{WINESTEAD HOSPITAL}
Many trees have been affected by Dutch Elm disease and have been removed. One thousand new trees have recently been planted to replace these. It was felt that the attitude of people toward the patients is generally sympathetic. A Garden Party organised by the Hospital League of Friends is held annually in the Hopital Grounds and in 1985 raised over Â£900 to be used on amenities and activites for the patients. At the present time there is a lot of controversy over whether to close Winestead Hospital but at a recently held annual Garden Party one patient was heard to say to a Hospital official, "Don't close this place will you, because we like it here and all my friends are here".
